solution: Define average number of newborn children per adult blue jay in Hamilton Farm as B; so B = 3. Define adult owl in Bundle Ranch as G; so G = B = 3. Define adult owl in Hamilton Farm as V; A = G = 3; so V = 1 + A = 1 + 3 = 4. Define average number of newborn children per adult owl in Jefferson Circus as q; so q = V + G = 4 + 3 = 7. Define average number of newborn children per adult eagle in Hamilton Farm as Z; e = N = 10; so Z = 1 + e = 1 + 10 = 11. Define adult crow in Jefferson Circus as P; X = Z = 11; so P = 3 * X = 3 * 11 = 33. Define average number of newborn children per adult parrot in Hamilton Farm as p; so p = P = 33. Define average number of newborn children per adult crow in Jefferson Circus as K; so K = p + Z = 33 + 11 = 44. Define adult owl in Jefferson Circus as n; so n = K + q = 44 + 7 = 51. Answer: 51.

solution: Define adult bear in Mayer Aquarium as E; so E = 2. Define adult racoon in Hamilton Farm as m; Y = E = 2; so m = 3 * Y = 3 * 2 = 6. Define adult bear in Hamilton Farm as y; z = m - E = 6 - 2 = 4; so y = 2 * z = 2 * 4 = 8. Define average number of newborn children per adult racoon in Jefferson Circus as T; X = y + E = 8 + 2 = 10; h = X + m = 10 + 6 = 16; so T = 4 + h = 4 + 16 = 20. Define average number of newborn children per adult bear in Hamilton Farm as A; s = T + E = 20 + 2 = 22; C = s + y = 22 + 8 = 30; so A = C + m = 30 + 6 = 36. Define average number of newborn children per adult deer in South Zoo as c; l = A + E = 36 + 2 = 38; so c = 1 + l = 1 + 38 = 39. Answer: 39.

solution: Define average number of teachers per public highschool in Glenfield City as d; so d = 3. Define regional medical school in Glenfield City as I; i = d = 3; so I = 4 + i = 4 + 3 = 7. Define average number of teachers per regional medical school in Glenfield City as V; so V = I = 7. Define average number of teachers per culinarian school in Glenfield City as T; so T = 4. Define public highschool in Glenfield City as w; so w = V = 7. Define culinarian school in Glenfield City as C; so C = 3. Define total number of teachers from all schools in Glenfield City as N; Q = w * d = 7 * 3 = 21; P = C * T = 3 * 4 = 12; q = I * V = 7 * 7 = 49; e = Q + P = 21 + 12 = 33; N = e + q = 33 + 49 = 82. Define average number of teachers per regional medical school in Brightford as s; m = N = 82; so s = 4 + m = 4 + 82 = 86. Define average number of teachers per elementary school in Evervale City as a; so a = s - d = 86 - 3 = 83. Answer: 83.

solution: Define regional medical school in Evervale City as I; so I = 3. Define culinarian school in Evervale City as u; i = I = 3; so u = 4 + i = 4 + 3 = 7. Define average number of teachers per elementary school in Hawkesbury as o; V = u = 7; so o = 2 * V = 2 * 7 = 14. Define elementary school in Evervale City as E; f = o = 14; so E = 3 + f = 3 + 14 = 17. Define total number of schools in Evervale City as S; H = u + E = 7 + 17 = 24; so S = H + I = 24 + 3 = 27. Define average number of teachers per regional medical school in Brightford as v; x = S + I = 27 + 3 = 30; so v = x + E = 30 + 17 = 47. Define regional medical school in Brightford as q; d = u = 7; so q = 2 * d = 2 * 7 = 14. Define total number of teachers from all schools in Brightford as W; so W = q * v = 14 * 47 = 658. Answer: 658.

Define average number of newborn children per adult racoon in Jefferson Circus as H; G = y = 8; so H = 1 + G = 1 + 8 = 9. Define adult deer in Jefferson Circus as K; so K = H = 9. Define total number of newborn animal children in Jefferson Circus as N; l = i * H = (2) * (9) = 18; U = K * x = (9) * (x) = 9*x; N = l + U = 18 + 9*x = 9*x + 18. We know N = 36, so we have 9*x + 18 = 36 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 9*x + 18 = 36. Move all terms to one side: 9*x - 18 = 0. Isolate the term with x: 9*x = 18. Divide both sides by 9: x = 18 / 9. Solution: x = 2. Answer: 2.

solution: The question is difficult, so we use equations to solve it. Define average number of newborn children per adult crow in South Zoo as x; we don't know its value yet but will find it out later. Define average number of newborn children per adult parrot in South Zoo as z; U = x = x; so z = 3 * U = (3) * (x) = 3*x. Define average number of newborn children per adult blue jay in Hamilton Farm as N; so N = z = 3*x. Define average number of newborn children per adult parrot in Hamilton Farm as P; h = N = 3*x; so P = 4 + h = 4 + 3*x = 3*x + 4. Define adult parrot in South Zoo as d; q = P = 3*x + 4; so d = 2 * q = (2) * (3*x + 4) = 6*x + 8. Define adult crow in South Zoo as c; so c = P - x = (3*x + 4) - (x) = 2*x + 4. Define average number of newborn children per adult crow in Hamilton Farm as w; a = z = 3*x; so w = 4 + a = 4 + 3*x = 3*x + 4. Define adult blue jay in South Zoo as D; G = w = 3*x + 4; so D = 2 * G = (2) * (3*x + 4) = 6*x + 8. Define total number of adult animals in South Zoo as Z; A = d + c = 6*x + 8 + 2*x + 4 = 8*x + 12; so Z = A + D = 8*x + 12 + 6*x + 8 = 14*x + 20. We know Z = 62, so we have 14*x + 20 = 62 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 14*x + 20 = 62. Move all terms to one side: 14*x - 42 = 0. Isolate the term with x: 14*x = 42. Divide both sides by 14: x = 42 / 14. Solution: x = 3. Answer: 3.

question: What is the average number of newborn children per adult wolf in Bundle Ranch?
solution: The question is difficult, so we use equations to solve it. Define average number of newborn children per adult wolf in Bundle Ranch as x; we don't know its value yet but will find it out later. Define adult bear in South Zoo as b; F = x = x; so b = 4 + F = 4 + x = x + 4. Define adult wolf in Bundle Ranch as V; z = b = x + 4; so V = 2 + z = 2 + x + 4 = x + 6. Define adult racoon in Jefferson Circus as G; Z = V + x = x + 6 + x = 2*x + 6; P = Z + b = 2*x + 6 + x + 4 = 3*x + 10; so G = 2 * P = (2) * (3*x + 10) = 6*x + 20. Define average number of newborn children per adult racoon in Bundle Ranch as f; Y = G + b = 6*x + 20 + x + 4 = 7*x + 24; t = Y + V = 7*x + 24 + x + 6 = 8*x + 30; so f = t + x = 8*x + 30 + x = 9*x + 30. Define adult racoon in Bundle Ranch as m; E = f - x = (9*x + 30) - (x) = 8*x + 30; so m = 4 * E = (4) * (8*x + 30) = 32*x + 120. Define adult wolf in South Zoo as o; so o = m = 32*x + 120. We know o = 248, so we have 32*x + 120 = 248 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 32*x + 120 = 248. Move all terms to one side: 32*x - 128 = 0. Isolate the term with x: 32*x = 128. Divide both sides by 32: x = 128 / 32. Solution: x = 4. Answer: 4.

Define public highschool in Hawkesbury as S; b = W = 16; so S = 4 * b = (4) * (16) = 64. Define average number of teachers per public highschool in Hawkesbury as F; G = S + W = 64 + 16 = 80; so F = 1 + G = 1 + 80 = 81. Define average number of teachers per culinarian school in Brightford as E; j = F = 81; so E = 1 + j = 1 + 81 = 82. Define private middle school in Brightford as T; O = E = 82; so T = 2 * O = (2) * (82) = 164. Define culinarian school in Brightford as x; we don't know its value yet but will find it out later. Define total number of schools in Brightford as g; so g = x + T = x + 164 = x + 164. We know g = 168, so we have x + 164 = 168 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: x + 164 = 168. Move all terms to one side: x - 4 = 0. Isolate the term with x: 1*x = 4. Divide both sides by 1: x = 4 / 1. Solution: x = 4. Answer: 4.
